creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: scene in a garden with numerous stone lamps of various kinds and many potted plants; squatting man at left tending to a bonsai, wearing a blue tunic, grey pants and a white headband
inscription: left: 昭和十六年作　石燈籠 {Shōwa jūrokunen saku, [?????]} | bottom, in grey: Stone Lanterns | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Stone Lanterns
